Angsana Trotoar Cikini Ditebas, KPBB: DKI Langgar Komitmen Iklim
05 Nov 2019, 04:37 by Antara, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komite Penghapusan Bensin Bertimbal (KPBB) mengatakan pemotongan pohon jenis Angsana di sepanjang trotoar Cikini merupakan pelanggaran komitmen Pemprov DKI Jakarta dalam melindungi iklim untuk mengurangi emisi gas rumah kaca sebesar 30 persen hingga 2030 nanti.
"Jelas bahwa penebangan-penebangan pohon tersebut kontradiktif dengan komitmen pemerintah untuk menurunkan emisi gas rumah kaca, menurunkan temperatur iklim lokal dan memerangi peningkatan suhu kawasan kota," kata Direktur Eksekutif KPBB Ahmad Safrudin saat dihubungi di Jakarta, Selasa, 5 November 2019 terkait penebangan pohon di trotoar Cikini tersebut.
Pria yang akrab disapa Puput itu mengatakan seharusnya Pemerintah tetap mempertahankan pohon- pohon yang sudah ada karena Ruang Terbuka Hijau (RTH) di Jakarta yang ditargetkan sebanyak 20 persen pada 2030 baru terpenuhi sebesar 9,4 persen.
Selain dapat mengurangi emisi gas rumah kaca diketahui dapat juga menyerap polutan yang menjadi salah satu masalah buruknya udara di Jakarta.
"Risiko batang tumbang dan cabang patah sebenarnya bisa diantisipasi dengan pemangkasan dahan secara teratur," kata Puput menanggapi alasan Pemprov DKI menebang pohon Angsana.
Lebih lanjut, Puput menilai keinginan Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta menggantikan Pohon Angsana dengan Pohon Tabebuya kurang tepat dinilai dari segi fungsinya.
"Tabebuya yang akan dijadikan pengganti Angsana hanya memiliki 7,8% kemampuan menyerap CO2 atau 24,2 gr/jam sementara Angsana mampu mengcapture 310 gr/jam. Artinya kemampuan Tabebuya hanya 7,8% dari kemampuan Angsana dalam menyerap CO2," kata Puput.
Sebelumnya, Dinas Kehutanan DKI Jakarta melakukan penebangan pohon di sepanjang trotoar Cikini bersamaan dengan penataan trotoar yang dilakukan oleh Dinas Bina Marga DKI.
Selain agar menciptakan trotoar yang nyaman bagi pejalan kaki, penebangan pohon jenis Angsana dan Beringin di Cikini dilakukan untuk peremajaan tanaman.
"Kelemahannya untuk jenis Angsana adalah seiring usia pohon yang semakin tua, struktur cabang dan batangnya mudah keropos dan rapuh. Dikhawatirkan mudah patah cabangnya dan bahkan tumbang. Dampaknya tentu membahayakan pengguna jalan apalagi keberadaannya di trotoar," kata Suzi, soal komplain penebangan Angsana di trotoar Cikini tersebut.

Angsana Sidewalk Cikini Cut, KPBB: DKI Violates Climate Commitment
05 Nov 2019, 04:37 by Antara, Dwi Arjanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Committee for the Elimination of Leaded Gasoline (KPBB) said cutting Angsana trees along the Cikini sidewalk was a violation of DKI Jakarta Provincial Government's commitment to protect the climate to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 30 percent until 2030.
"It is clear that these tree fellings contradict the government's commitment to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, reduce local climate temperatures and combat rising temperatures in urban areas," said KPBB Executive Director Ahmad Safrudin when contacted in Jakarta on Tuesday, November 5, 2019 regarding tree felling on the Cikini sidewalk.
The man who is familiarly called Puput said that the government should keep the existing trees because the Green Open Space (RTH) in Jakarta which is targeted to reach 20 percent by 2030 has only been fulfilled by 9.4 percent.
Besides being able to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, it is known that it can also absorb pollutants which is one of the problems of poor air in Jakarta.
"The risk of fallen stems and broken branches can actually be anticipated by regular branch pruning," Puput said in response to the reason the DKI Provincial Government was cutting Angsana trees.
Furthermore, Puput assessed that the desire of the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government to replace the Angsana Tree with the Tabebuya Tree was not appropriately assessed in terms of its function.
"Tabebuya which will be used as a substitute for Angsana only has 7.8% ability to absorb CO2 or 24.2 g / hour while Angsana can capture 310 gr / hour. It means that Tabebuya's ability is only 7.8% of Angsana's ability to absorb CO2," Puput said .
Previously, the DKI Jakarta Forestry Service was cutting down trees along the Cikini sidewalk in conjunction with the arrangement of the sidewalks carried out by the DKI Jakarta Bina Marga Office.
In addition to creating a comfortable sidewalk for pedestrians, the cutting of Angsana and Banyan trees in Cikini is carried out to rejuvenate plants.
